question: Which is used to measure the Time complexity of an algorithm Big O notation?
options: a) describes limiting behaviour of the function
b) characterises a function based on growth of function
c) upper bound on growth rate of the function
explanation: Big O notation describes limiting behaviour, and also gives upper bound on growth rate of a function.

question: If for an algorithm time complexity is given by O(1) then the complexity of it is ____________
explanation: The growth rate of that function will be constant.

question: If for an algorithm time complexity is given by O(log
explanation: The growth rate of that function will be logarithmic therefore complexity will be logarithmic.

question: If for an algorithm time complexity is given by O(n) then the complexity of it is ___________
explanation: The growth rate of that function will be linear.

question: If for an algorithm time complexity is given by O(n
explanation: The growth rate of that function will be quadratic therefore complexity will be quadratic.

question: The time complexity of binary search is given by ___________
The time complexity of the linear search is given by ___________
explanation: It is O(n), therefore complexity will be linear.

question: Which algorithm is better for sorting between bubble sort and quicksort?
explanation: Running time of quicksort is logarithmic whereas for bubble sort it is quadratic.

question: Time complexity of the binary search algorithm is constant.
